A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
When the movie ended\, my wife looked over at me and asked "What's wrong?". I just stared at the credits and responded with "WHAT WAS THAT?"

One hour into the movie I remember thinking that I had no interest in re-watching what I had just seen. It moved so slow and the galaxy felt like it was smaller than ever before. We got to watch a version of Luke that was such a disappointment. Force flying Leia was a disaster. How many more cute space animals/creatures could Disney squeeze into their theme park gift stores? Snoke was a waste. Phasma was a waste. And the slow motion spaceship tailgating of the other spaceship never ended.

Maybe I am most disappointed in the fact that my expectations were just shattered. I thought Kylo Ren would be more powerful and awesome. Instead he was mask-less the entire movie and seemed even weaker than the TFA. We also deserved a powerful and wise Luke Skywalker. Instead\, we got an old wimpy man who died in a force projecting battle. We've now had 3 straight Disney Star Wars movies without ONE lightsaber battle between two skilled/trained Jedis (though Vader in Rogue One was an epic solo performance).

We all deserved a battle between Kylo Ren and green lightsaber Luke. Instead we got an invisible tickle battle that somehow killed Luke. Why are we supposed to be excited for Episode IX?
